intro: Sideroxylon spathulatum var. densiflorum, commonly known as the dense-flowered ironwood, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized tree characterized by its hard, dense wood and thick, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish flowers, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
